headline: Ohio schools will be required to give annual dyslexia screenings beginning next school year
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Mike DeWine will require school districts and other public schools to administer annual dyslexia screenings to students.
The bill will require schools to give the dyslexia screenings to students starting in the 2022-2023 school year.
School districts must also establish a multi-sensory structured literacy certification process for teachers.
The bill focuses on dyslexia screening, intervention and remediation.

COLUMBUS, Ohio â€”
A bill signed into law by Ohio Gov.
DeWine signed House Bill 436 into law on Jan. 9.
